channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-2513] OSE Fuse JVM sometimes dies with SIGABRT
item.description:
Fuse cartridge sometime crashes with SIGABRT on RHEL 6.6 and the supported openjdk version. I have reproduced it several times on different machines running RHEL 6.6 and OpenJDK 1.7

(gdb) bt
 
#0  0x00007f462b5cb625 in raise (sig=6) at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
 
#1  0x00007f462b5cce05 in abort () at abort.c:92
 
#2  0x00007f462af6f6c5 in os::abort (dump_core=true) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/os/linux/vm/os_linux.cpp:1615
 
#3  0x00007f462b0e11cf in VMError::report_and_die (this=0x7f45c887bc30) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/utilities/vmError.cpp:1072
 
#4  0x00007f462b0e189b in crash_handler (sig=11, info=0x7f45c887bdf0, ucVoid=0x7f45c887bcc0) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/os/linux/vm/vmError_linux.cpp:106
 
#5  <signal handler called>
 
#6  os::print_hex_dump (st=0x7f45c887c820, start=<value optimized out>, end=0x3b8726af30 <Address 0x3b8726af30 out of bounds>, unitsize=1)
 
    at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/runtime/os.cpp:780
 
#7  0x00007f462b0e0468 in VMError::report (this=0x7f45c887c9a0, st=0x7f45c887c820) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/utilities/vmError.cpp:549
 
#8  0x00007f462b0e0d3d in VMError::report_and_die (this=0x7f45c887c9a0) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/utilities/vmError.cpp:1006
 
#9  0x00007f462af74af2 in JVM_handle_linux_signal (sig=11, info=0x7f45c887cb70, ucVoid=0x7f45c887ca40, abort_if_unrecognized=-930625248)
 
    at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/os_cpu/linux_x86/vm/os_linux_x86.cpp:531
 
#10 <signal handler called>
 
#11 0x0000003b8726af10 in ?? ()
 
#12 0x00007f462bd45a69 in __nptl_deallocate_tsd (arg=0x7f45c887d700) at pthread_create.c:154
 
#13 start_thread (arg=0x7f45c887d700) at pthread_create.c:308
 
#14 0x00007f462b6818fd in clone () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:115

Possibly related to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1051987
item.summary: OSE Fuse JVM sometimes dies with SIGABRT

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Debugging it further, looking for all the cases of pthread_key_create

The problematic callback has been registered by glib when used by GnomeFileTypeDetector

So it seems that gio has probably been dlclosed without cleaning up its thread?

Breakpoint 1, __pthread_key_create (key=0x7ff1c464a990, destr=0x329706af10 <g_thread_cleanup>) at pthread_key_create.c:29
 
29  {
 
Missing separate debuginfos, use: debuginfo-install libselinux-2.0.94-5.8.el6.x86_64
 
(gdb) bt
 
#0  __pthread_key_create (key=0x7ff1c464a990, destr=0x329706af10 <g_thread_cleanup>) at pthread_key_create.c:29
 
#1  0x0000003298002247 in g_private_new_posix_impl (destructor=<value optimized out>) at gthread-posix.c:269
 
#2  0x000000329706b333 in g_thread_init_glib () at gthread.c:937
 
#3  0x000000329842c48f in g_type_init_with_debug_flags (debug_flags=G_TYPE_DEBUG_NONE) at gtype.c:4266
 
#4  0x00007ff3e74d73ba in gio_init () at ../../../src/solaris/native/common/deps/glib2/gio_fp.c:59
 
#5  0x00007ff3e74d470f in Java_sun_nio_fs_GnomeFileTypeDetector_initializeGio (env=<value optimized out>, this=<value optimized out>) at ../../../src/solaris/native/sun/nio/fs/GnomeFileTypeDetector.c:68
 
#6  0x00007ff3f42f27f8 in ?? ()
 
#7  0x00007ff1d0034000 in ?? ()
 
#8  0x00007ff3d6ee8228 in ?? ()
 
#9  0x00000000d5907840 in ?? ()
 
#10 0x00007ff3d6ee8280 in ?? ()
 
#11 0x00000000d5909710 in ?? ()
 
#12 0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()


Program received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
 
[Switching to Thread 0x7ff3d6eee700 (LWP 21860)]
 
0x00007ff3f8dfe625 in raise (sig=6) at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
 
64	  return INLINE_SYSCALL (tgkill, 3, pid, selftid, sig);
 
(gdb) bt
 
#0  0x00007ff3f8dfe625 in raise (sig=6) at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
 
#1  0x00007ff3f8dffe05 in abort () at abort.c:92
 
#2  0x00007ff3f879f9e5 in os::abort (dump_core=true) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/os/linux/vm/os_linux.cpp:1615
 
#3  0x00007ff3f891381f in VMError::report_and_die (this=0x7ff3d6eecc30) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/utilities/vmError.cpp:1073
 
#4  0x00007ff3f8913eeb in crash_handler (sig=11, info=0x7ff3d6eecdf0, ucVoid=0x7ff3d6eeccc0) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/os/linux/vm/vmError_linux.cpp:106
 
#5  <signal handler called>
 
#6  os::print_hex_dump (st=0x7ff3d6eed820, start=<value optimized out>, end=0x329706af30 <Address 0x329706af30 out of bounds>, unitsize=1)
 
    at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/runtime/os.cpp:780
 
#7  0x00007ff3f8912ab8 in VMError::report (this=0x7ff3d6eed9a0, st=0x7ff3d6eed820) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/utilities/vmError.cpp:550
 
#8  0x00007ff3f891338d in VMError::report_and_die (this=0x7ff3d6eed9a0) at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/share/vm/utilities/vmError.cpp:1007
 
#9  0x00007ff3f87a4e12 in JVM_handle_linux_signal (sig=11, info=0x7ff3d6eedb70, ucVoid=0x7ff3d6eeda40, abort_if_unrecognized=-688989920)
 
    at /usr/src/debug/java-1.7.0-openjdk/openjdk/hotspot/src/os_cpu/linux_x86/vm/os_linux_x86.cpp:531
 
#10 <signal handler called>
 
#11 0x000000329706af10 in ?? ()
 
#12 0x00007ff3f9578a69 in __nptl_deallocate_tsd (arg=0x7ff3d6eee700) at pthread_create.c:154
 
#13 start_thread (arg=0x7ff3d6eee700) at pthread_create.c:308
 
#14 0x00007ff3f8eb48fd in clone () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:115

It seems that gio is immediately unloaded, which may be the problem, as if I understand that code properly, that should only happen if gio is not successfully loaded / initialized... 

Breakpoint 2, __dlclose (handle=0x7f61540149e0) at dlclose.c:42
 
42	{
 
(gdb) bt
 
#0  __dlclose (handle=0x7f61540149e0) at dlclose.c:42
 
#1  0x00007f636ca7f5b8 in gio_init () at ../../../src/solaris/native/common/deps/glib2/gio_fp.c:104
 
#2  0x00007f636ca7c70f in Java_sun_nio_fs_GnomeFileTypeDetector_initializeGio (env=<value optimized out>, this=<value optimized out>) at ../../../src/solaris/native/sun/nio/fs/GnomeFileTypeDetector.c:68
 
#3  0x00007f63750127f8 in ?? ()
 
#4  0x00007f6254001000 in ?? ()
 
#5  0x00007f635d7d12a8 in ?? ()
 
#6  0x00000000d4161318 in ?? ()
 
#7  0x00007f635d7d1300 in ?? ()
 
#8  0x00000000d41631e8 in ?? ()
 
#9  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
Opened https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1190835

A workaround for the RHEL issue could be to not use java.nio.file.Files.probeContentType

(used by

  [1] java.nio.file.Files.probeContentType (Files.java:1,569)
 
  [2] io.hawt.util.Files.getMimeType (Files.java:112)
 
  [3] io.hawt.git.FileInfo.createFileInfo (FileInfo.java:38)
 
  [4] io.hawt.git.GitFacadeSupport.doRead (GitFacadeSupport.java:423)
 
  [5] io.fabric8.git.hawtio.FabricGitFacade.access$300 (FabricGitFacade.java:51)
 
  [6] io.fabric8.git.hawtio.FabricGitFacade$4.call (FabricGitFacade.java:126)
 
  [7] io.fabric8.git.hawtio.FabricGitFacade$4.call (FabricGitFacade.java:123)
 
  [8] io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.executeInternal (GitDataStoreImpl.java:989)
 
  [9] io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.gitOperation (GitDataStoreImpl.java:938)
 
  [10] io.fabric8.git.hawtio.FabricGitFacade.gitReadOperation (FabricGitFacade.java:331)
 
  [11] io.fabric8.git.hawtio.FabricGitFacade.read (FabricGitFacade.java:123)
Marek Schmidt Is there any news on getting JVM patch or do we need to investigate working around this in Fuse code?
Jimmi Dyson Can you take a look at this one? If we can't get JVM patch then we'll need to work around in HawtIO.
OK I'll take a look at patching hawtio. Who can help me with an environment to test this out on?
Aha! OK thanks Marek - was going on the steps to reproduce.
Kevin was setting up OS2 env in Jenkins to be able to run smoke tests

I have spent a couple of hours today trying to recreate this, but cannot get it to happen. I've opened up the wiki, browsed, viewed files, edited files, created new, just let the browser sit there... no joy in recreating at all. I have used the latest available java-1.7.0-openjdk-devel java-1.7.0-openjdk RPM in RHEL 6.6 channels - java-1.7.0-openjdk-devel-1.7.0.75-2.5.4.0.el6_6.x86_64.

Marek Schmidt - can you try to recreate with this version of the RPM to see if it has been fixed?

yes, I can reproduce it with 6.2.0.redhat-075 with

java-1.7.0-openjdk.x86_64 1:1.7.0.75-2.5.4.0.el6_6 @rhel-x86_64-server-6
java-1.7.0-openjdk-devel.x86_64 1:1.7.0.75-2.5.4.0.el6_6 @rhel-x86_64-server-6

(steps I did to reproduce it: edit users.properties to enable admin user, run bin/fuse, fabric:create, wait for provisioning, login to hawtio, open the wiki tab and then deploy quickstarts-cxf-rest (which probably recreates the thread pool)

Also note that the JDK issue may depend on other packages being installed or not installed (maybe glib2, libgnomevfs, perhaps others), attaching my current "yum list installed"
OK managed to reproduce now. Will work on a fix - should have something soon.

I've just had the same error but with a different stack so I think the only real fix for this is to get glib fixed in RHEL 6.6. I have tried the code https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1051987 to reproduce the issue & it exists as described in the bug report.

I'm just generating a core dump so that I can double check the stack to see if it is indeed exhibited in multiple places. If so, it is really going to need a glib fix rather than multiple workarounds in hawtio, which might not even be possible to cover all eventualities.
Looking at it again with Marek Schmidt it is actually a JDK issue. not a glib issue.
This will require a fix for OpenJDK in RHEL 6.6

This issue is now also triggered by apache-camel org.apache.camel.component.file.GenericFiles since apache-camel 2.15 upgrade.

This can be reproduced by the beginner/camel-cbr quickstart (deploy, move the data files to input, undeploy, notice the crash)

Release is imminent, they are just finalising docs.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1217984

https://errata.devel.redhat.com/advisory/20465
Jimmi Dyson Patch is now available, can you test that this fixes the SIGABRT?
Tested & bug seems to have been fixed.

We should release note this issue to warn RHEL customers to upgrade openjdk to java-1.7.0-openjdk-1.7.0.79-2.5.5.3.el6_6 or later.

Aileen Cunningham Is "Affects Release Notes" JIRA flag sufficient, or do I need to open a JIRA for docs?

Verified on current RHEL 6.6

$ java -version
java version "1.7.0_79"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (rhel-2.5.5.3.el6_6-x86_64 u79-b14)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.79-b02, mixed mode)
Great! We are gathering release note info in FUSEDOC-471.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. create fuse cartridge
  2. create additional openshift container from hawt.io
  3. let it run until it crashes... (I am not sure if there is anything special to make it crash)
